p: After 10 experimental passages, we used replicated ( n = 3) fitness assays to measure the average growth performance at 40°C of each endpoint population in the two treatment groups (constant, random). Results (Figure 2) yielded mean log10 absolute fitness values for each constant population (37A: 9.73 ± 0.06 s.d.m.; 37B: 9.54 ± 0.104 s.d.m.; 37C: 9.85 ± 0.07 s.d.m.; 37D: 9.51 ± 0.09 s.d.m.; 37E: 9.72 ± 0.03 s.d.m. log10 PFU/ml). We then compared the dataset for each population to the mean fitness of its founding ancestral gene pool (9.64 ± 0.21 s.d.m. log10 PFU/ml). This statistical analysis showed that none of the 5 populations evolved increased fitness at 40°C relative to the common ancestor (File S4).
